title: Create a React Library
description: Create a React Library for an Nx workspace.

examples.description: Generate a library with routes and add them to `myapp`

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the library?

directory.description: A directory where the lib is placed.

projectNameAndRootFormat.description: Whether to generate the project name and root directory as provided (`as-provided`) or generate them composing their values and taking the configured layout into account (`derived`).

style.description: The file extension to be used for style files.

x-prompt.message: Which stylesheet format would you like to use?

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.

unitTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for unit tests.
unitTestRunner.x-prompt: What unit test runner should be used?

inSourceTests.description: When using Vitest, separate spec files will not be generated and instead will be included within the source files.

tags.description: Add tags to the library (used for linting).

skipTsConfig.description: Do not update `tsconfig.json` for development experience.

pascalCaseFiles.description: Use pascal case component file name (e.g. `App.tsx`).

appProject.description: The application project to add the library route to.

buildable.description: Generate a buildable library that uses rollup to bundle.
buildable.x-deprecated: Use the `bundler` option for greater control (none, vite, rollup).

importPath.description: The library name used to import it, like `@myorg/my-awesome-lib`.

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

globalCss.description: When `true`, the stylesheet is generated using global CSS instead of CSS modules (e.g. file is `*.css` rather than `*.module.css`).

strict.description: Whether to enable tsconfig strict mode or not.

setParserOptionsProject.description: Whether or not to configure the ESLint `parserOptions.project` option. We do not do this by default for lint performance reasons.

bundler.description: The bundler to use. Choosing 'none' means this library is not buildable.
bundler.x-prompt: Which bundler would you like to use to build the library? Choose 'none' to skip build setup.

minimal.description: Create a React library with a minimal setup, no separate test files.

simpleName.description: Don't include the directory in the name of the module of the library.
